column4: Hi. I'm experiencing a strange problem with my internet. Well, I can't access it. I can connect to my wi-fi network, but I can't access the internet. This is strange, because I can do so from a custom LiveCD I have, and my brother's computer is working just fine too. Does anyone know what might cause this?
Type ifconfig and pastebin your wireless interface?
That would be impossible. Sure, I can do it from the LiveCD. But the liveCD is working. The installed OS is not. It can't access the internet, so I can't pastebin it. :(
Actually, what I can do... and it will probably take a while... is to reboot to the installed OS, ifconfig, output to a file, boot to the live CD, and then pastebin it.
Okay...well in that case. You need to *boot* into Ubuntu and just check ifconfig to see whether your interface is getting an ip assigned.
What if I already know that it is? This CD... or DVD, rather... takes a while to boot. I'd like to gather up a bunch of things to try, and do them all at once.
No worries. && Could someone take a look here?
You can go to your router page right?
That could be. What would I do to fix those?
There you go. Checklist. Pastebin ifconfig. Run netstat -rn. Pastebin that, too.
Okay. I'll pastebin ifconfig and netstat -rn. Should I do it from here on the live CD too? To have something to compare to?
Good idea.
For netstat -rn, it's the same for the installed and the livedvd. Here's the pastebin: http://pastebin.com/f583783b1
As for ifconfig, well, here is the installed's ifconfig: http://pastebin.com/f2fa9176e And here is the livedvd's ifconfig: http://pastebin.com/f23b01413
That seems to be correct.
Everything seems to be fine with your configuration.
I noticed that the hwaddr's were different between the two. What is "hwaddr"?
That's the MAC address of your card.
That's the MAC address of your card.
Unless your router has got MAC filtering enabled, I don't know what's wrong. :/
Oh. Well what's an MAC address? :P
It's like an unique ID number for your wireless card. :-)
okay. Thanks for your help anyways.
